oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and structural characterization of the heterometallic clusters cpcofe(2)(mu(3)-se)(2)(co)(6) and cpcofe(2)(mu(3)-s)(mu(3)-se)(co)(6)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MATHUR, P
SEKAR, P
SATYANARAYANA, CVV
MAHON, MF
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: chalcogen carbonyl-compounds
bidentate organosulfur ligands
transition-metal carbonyls
s-s bond
coordination chemistry
organic disulfides
complexes
reactivity
(mu-dithio)bis(tricarbonyliron)
construction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The heterometallic clusters CpCoFe(2)(mu(3)-Se)(2)(CO)(6) (1) and CpCoFe(2)(mu(3)-S)(mu(3)-Se)(CO)(6) (2) were prepared in moderate yield from the room-temperature reaction of the mixed-chalcogenide compound (CO)(6)Fe-2(mu-SSe) with freshly prepared CpCo(CO)(2). Both clusters were characterized by elemental analysis, IR, and H-1, C-13, and Se-77 NMR as well as X-ray diffraction analysis. Compound I crystallized in the triclinic space group P ($) over bar 1, with a = 6.638(1) Angstrom, b = 14.675(4) Angstrom, c = 17.844(7) Angstrom, alpha = 111.37(3)degrees, beta = 100.80(2)degrees, gamma = 89.88(2)degrees, V = 1585.9 Angstrom(3), Z = 4, D-c = 2.35 g cm(-3), R = 3.85% and R(w) = 3.12%. Compound 2 crystallized in the monoclinic space group C2/c with a = 34.994(10) Angstrom, b = 6.599(2) Angstrom, c = 14.766(5) Angstrom, beta = 111.95(3)degrees, V = 3162.7 Angstrom(3), Z = 8, D-c = 2.16 g cm(-3), R = 3.51%, and R(w) = 3.26%. Both clusters consist of square pyramidal cores of Fe2CoSe2 and Fe2CoSSe, respectively, and in each case the Co atom occupies the apical site of the square pyramid.
